title: 113_hr5503
content: The Act is titled the "James Zadroga 9/11 Health and Compensation Reauthorization Act" and reauthorizes the World Trade Center Health Program. The "James Zadroga 9/11 Health and Compensation Reauthorization Act" amends the World Trade Center Health Program Fund to extend funding from 2015 through 2041. The Federal share starts at $431,000,000 for fiscal year 2015 and increases annually until 2041. The "James Zadroga 9/11 Health and Compensation Reauthorization Act" extends funding for the World Trade Center Health Program from 2015 through 2041. The Federal share increases annually based on the medical care component of the consumer price index. Amounts from prior fiscal years are also addressed. The "James Zadroga 9/11 Health and Compensation Reauthorization Act" extends funding for the World Trade Center Health Program until 2041. Amounts not spent in previous fiscal years will be deposited into the Fund and remain available until expended. Amendments are made to subsections regarding the consumer price index for urban consumers. The consumer price index for urban consumers is amended for fiscal years 2013 through 2014, with specific amounts allocated for fiscal years 2015 and beyond. The consumer price index for urban consumers is adjusted annually based on the percentage increase in the consumer price index for all urban consumers. Amendments are made for fiscal years 2013 through 2016. The WTC Program Administrator can issue regulations as needed to administer this title, including adjustments based on the consumer price index for urban consumers. The WTC Program Administrator can issue regulations as needed to administer this title, including adjustments based on the consumer price index for urban consumers. Amendments are made to Section 3305 of the Public Health Service Act regarding Clinical Centers of Excellence and Data Centers. Amendments are made to various sections of the Public Health Service Act related to World Trade Center responders, survivors, and payment of claims, extending deadlines to 2041. The World Trade Center Health Registry is also updated. The Health Service Act is amended to change the date from "April 20, 2009" to "September 7, 2014." Reauthorizing the September 11th Victim Compensation Fund of 2001. The Air Transportation Safety and System Stabilization Act is being amended to remove references to the World Trade Center Health Program, adjust the purpose section for full compensation, and update timing requirements for filing a claim. The Air Transportation Safety and System Stabilization Act is being amended to update references to section 407(b)(1) and section 406(d) for eligibility and payment adjustments. The Air Transportation Safety and System Stabilization Act is being amended to update references for eligibility and payment adjustments by replacing specific monetary amounts with necessary sums to carry out the Act. Additionally, regulations regarding payment amounts to claimants are being revised. Regulations regarding payment amounts to claimants are being revised, including the James Zadroga 9/11 Health and Compensation Act of 2010 and its reauthorization act. Amendment to exempt programs under the Balanced Budget and Emergency Deficit Control Act of 1985 includes adding the September 11th Victim Compensation Fund and the World Trade Center Health Program Fund. These amendments apply to any sequestration order issued after the enactment of this Act.
